hackathon-description-text: The School’s Out Hackathon is a 24 hour coding event for high school students from across San Antonio the great area. With over 200 participants, expert mentors, and in-depth workshops design to help people code, it promises to ensure that everyone can have a fun experience getting introduced to programming with their peers.
hackathon-requirements: As long as it's built at the hackathon and is technological, you're good to go (hopefully uses code)!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Tablets! Best Software Hack as chosen by judging panel.
Full Arduino Kits! Best Hardware hack as chosen by judging panel.
Dell Tablets. Prize given by Microsoft for best Use of Microsoft Technology
CodeUp Mini Camp! Given to the favorite beginner hack of the CodeUp/Scale Team
Complete Raspberry Pi Kit! Best Beginner hack as chosen by judging panel.
Pebbles for the team. This goes to the best Pebble hack. If no hacks are created with Pebble, it goes to the Best Design Hack.
Best Educational Hack. Chosen by SoHacks/Apps for Aptitude staff.
4 Leap Motions. Chosen by SoHacks Judging Panel

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 Trinity Place, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Taking a creative approach to an
issue is perhaps one of the key
ideas behind a hackathon. Projects
should exhibit some degree of
creativity in their final product.

Projects should attempt to
solve common problems in our
society today. Solutions should
be innovative and effective to earn full points in this category.

A well designed product tends
to do well in today’s marketplace,
and so the hacks should show
some element of good design
in them. Whether it is flat or
skeuomorphic, a design should be
pleasing to the eye

Advanced technology is all
around us. At hackathons,
products should use as many
tools as possible to make sure
that the product is the best
it can be

hackathon-location-address: 1 Trinity Place, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA
hackathon-description-header: A high school hackathon engineered to help you learn to code!
